description: Micro Processor System Cartridge 1: Olympics contains 60 game variations, most of them Pong variants. Games included are 10 Ping Pong variants, 10 Hockey variants, 5 Tennis variants, 5 Volleyball variants, 10 Basketball variants and 20 Breakout variants. Many of the variants incur different penalties to the left or right player.
title: Pro Sport 60

alternate_titles.title: Micro Processor System Cartridge 2: Grand Prix

description: Auto Sports 10 is a top-down racing game with 10 variations. There are three different game types. Grand Prix uses a scrolling racetrack that is straight on which the player must avoid collision with other cars. Monte Carly Rally is similar but with bends in the road and other hazards. Brands Hatch shows a fixed-screen top-down racetrack with many tight bends that must be lapped.
title: Auto Sports 10

description: Blackjack plays the classic card game using Las Vegas rules. Players try to get their card value as close to 21 without going over. On a turn, the player can either hit, stay or double. The player can also accept or refuse insurance.
title: Blackjack

alternate_titles.title: Cassette 4: Bataille de Blindés / Combat Aerien
Micro Processor System Cartridge 4: Tank/Plane Battle

description: Tank/Plane Battle features 26 different game variations. There are sixteen top-down tank battle games with different playfield conditions (day/night, clear or with various different barricades or minefields) and ten top-down flight combat games with different types of airplanes (biplanes, jets) and cloud formations.
title: Tank/Plane Battle

alternate_titles.title: Micro Processor System Cartridge 5: Air/Sea Attack
Systeme Cassette A Microprocesseur 5: Air/Sea Attack

description: Air/Sea Attack features 20 different game variants. Eight variants feature air battles, the other twelve are sea battles. Games generally involve controlling a submarine, destroyer, or airplane each trying to drop bombs or fire torpedoes in an attempt to destroy each other. Different variants allow for one or two players.
title: Air/Sea Attack

alternate_titles.title: Micro Processor System Cartridge 6: Shooting Gallery
Systeme Cassette A Microprocesseur 6: Shooting Gallery

description: Shooting Gallery features 32 variations of target shooting for one or two players. Games feature various targets that run, swim, or fly across the screen for the player to shoot at. Later releases contained an additional modifier for 64 variations. The players are displayed at the bottom of the screen with animals moving in different layers above them.
title: Shooting Gallery

alternate_titles.title: Micro Processor System Cartridge 7: Basic Maths

description: Basic Maths is an educational game in which players solve sums of addition and subtraction. Players can compete for score. There are four difficulty levels.
title: Basic Maths

alternate_titles.title: Calcul Mental: Addition, Soustraction, Multiplication, Division

description: Maths Two is a similar game as Basic Maths, with the addition of division and multiplication.

sample_screenshots.caption: Division
Multiplication and addition
Multiplication

title: Maths Two

description:
Chess is a version of the classic board game of the same name. As an early version of computerized chess, the game does not feature a graphical depiction of the board nor the pieces. Instead, the player is expected to use their own physical board to supplement the gameplay and submit their moves (e.g. E2 - E4) into the game program.

Both one- and two-player modes are supported, along with six available levels of intelligence for the AI opponent. The game also features the ability to replay the log of a previously completed game in forward or reverse order. In an interesting twist, the option to disable the rules governing piece movement is available, allowing the player to move a piece anywhere on the board.

A sequel Chess II was later released.
title: Cassette 13: Chess

description: Computer Challenge is a computer version of Connect Four. Two players can play against each other or one player can play against the computer with three skill levels and two board sizes (7x6, 8x6). Just as in the popular board game players insert tokens and try to match up four in a row. Unlike tic-tac-toe, a token cannot be placed anywhere, but only in the bottom-most available row in a column.
title: Computer Challenge

description: Code Breaker is a computer version of the board game Mastermind. The computer thinks of a code and the player must try to guess it. After each guess the number of correct symbols and correct symbols in the correct location is made known, giving clues for the player to induce the actual code. There are 16 different game variants for one or two players, using four-digit codes. Depending on the game variation codes can consist of numbers and or symbols and a time limit can be present.
title: Code Breaker

alternate_titles.title: Micro Processor System Cartridge 11: Super Maze

description: Super Maze is a maze game in which one or two players must try to escape a maze. There are 24 different game variants, ranging from time-limited, one or two players, grid mode (passages only show after passing through), blind mode (walls only show after bumping into them), changing labyrinths, and a mode with a computer pawn that navigates the labyrinth in reverse order but may not be touched. Each game a point can be won. Points are reset once a player reaches 10 points.
title: Super Maze

alternate_titles.title: Micro Processor System Cartridge 12: Horse Racing

description: Horse Racing is an action game in which the player must jump a horse over hurdles at the right moment to prevent getting slowed down. There are sixteen different game variations, for one or two players, with water jumps. double oxers and moving the horses or scrolling the playfield.
title: Horse Racing

description: Circus is a variant of the 1977 Arcade game. The player controls a springboard at the bottom of the screen and must launch clowns into the air in order to pop balloons. There are sixteen different variations included.
title: Circus

description: Prizefight is a boxing game for two players. Players fight until a knockout or when a winner is declared based on points earned each round.
title: Prizefight

alternate_titles.title: Micro Processor System Cartridge 25: Electronic Pinball

description:
Pinball is an early pinball game with support for one or two players.

The playfield features six obstacles, whose labeled point values increment sequentially from one to nine when struck by the ball. Two turning mills at the top of the screen can be struck to close gates on the left and right sides of the playfield. After the score exceeds 200 points, the flippers become shorter, leaving more space between them for the ball to fall through.

There are four different variations of gameplay, allowing the player to choose one or two pairs of flippers with normal or fastball speed. Each player is allotted five balls per game.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is variation #5, with four flippers instead of two.
Playing along.
Game variation #1 is for one player and is of moderate speed. Players looking for a more challenging experience can try variation #3.

title: Electronic Pinball

description: Cassette 8: Memory / Flag Capture features 16 different game variants for one or two players. There are two basic variants. A concentration game in which pairs of tiles need to be found and a treasure hunt where one flag is hidden in the cards and players receive hints when looking around but are limited in movement.
title: Cassette 8: Memory / Flag Capture

description: Cassette 10: Winter Sports features two skiing games: ski jumping and slalom. Ski jumping uses both a side-view and a perspective birds-eye view to display the action. In the side view the skier can be seen going down the ramp and in the birds-eye view, the landing is witnessed. Different game settings have different wind behavior. The slalom game has no settings. The goal is to move the skier through the various gates.
title: Cassette 10: Winter Sports

description: Cassette 14: Motocross is confusingly, a drag racing game. Cars are shown in side-view similar to Atari's DragRace. The players must change gear at the right moment to reach top speed. After eight laps a winner is declared and a high-score is kept.
title: Cassette 14: Motocross

description: Cassette 19: Outer Space Combat contains multiple space-related games. Variant one has a cross-hair in the center of the screen that is used to fire at enemy space ships. Using the controller the player can line them up. Ships that aren't shot will ram the player and reduce points. Variant two is for two players where both players must coordinate to dock a spaceship on a space station. One player controls the ship, the other the station. The third variant has one player attacking the other from the left side of the screen. The other must dodge the laser fire. The fourth variant again places one player in the role of a combatant and the other making defensive maneuvers, but this time the combatant uses the first person targeting from variant one. All games last 99 seconds and are about scoring the most points. Additionally, each game has two speed variants.

sample_screenshots.caption: Double attack(For two players). Similar to the previous minigame, but this time one player controls two ships at a time, and the other tries to line up both and shoot them down.
Space Docking (For two players). One player controls the space station (White) and the other the spaceship (Yellow). Perform as many smooth dockings as possible.
Enemy Attack (For one player). Line up enemy vessels in your sights and blast them.
Duel in outer space (For two players). One player controls the green spacecraft while the other moves the crosshairs and fires shots against it.

title: Cassette 19: Outer Space Combat

description: Soccer lets two players play association football. The game is divided into two halves of 4.5 minutes and the sides are switched in the second half. Players use the keypad to select one of the 11 footballers in the field and move them around with the joystick. When in control the ball can be kicked in the direction of the joystick. The game also detects off-side, corners, and throw-ins.
title: Soccer

description: Follow the Leader / Electronic Music is a music cartridge that plays tunes and allows the player to record their own tunes. A game is also included in the form of a musical version of Simon Says. A series of notes are played and the player must repeat them by hitting the corresponding keys. The sequences get harder and longer the further the player gets without errors.
title: Follow the Leader / Electronic Music

description: Golf allows one or two players to play on a par-71 course. The player on stroke moves the golfer into position and stroke the ball. Clouds give an indication of wind speed and direction. Each hole has a different distance that must be crossed. In two-player mode, the player furthest away is the next to be on stroke.
title: Golf

description: Head On is a racing game in which the player must avoid collisions for as long as possible. The player can switch lanes to avoid head-on crashes and has three lives. The car will continuously speed up while the joystick is pushed to the right.
title: Head On

description: Draughts allows for one or two players to play the board game checkers. When playing against the computer the player can choose to play either black or white and between three difficulty levels. Also included is the easy difficulty level where pieces must be captured if possible. The last mode allows the player to set up the board in any desired way. It's possible to switch between game modes mid-game.
title: Draughts

description: Spider's Web is a Pac-Man variant. The player controls a spider-monster and must gobble up all insects in the top-down maze. Each insect eaten earns the player points. The player is chased by four horrors that must be avoided. Eating a green insect briefly grants the player the power to defeat the horrors. An extra life is gained if the player manages to eat four horrors within five seconds, allowing the player to score even more points. There are 12 game variations with different maze layouts, insect locations, and game speed.
title: Spider's Web

description: Cassette 21: Intelligence IV / Attack (Reversi) is a conversion of the board game Othello/Reversi. Players take turns to put markers on the board and capture any pieces that are enclosed in a straight or diagonal line. The game features variants for one or two players, with different handicaps and turn time limits.
title: Cassette 21: Intelligence IV / Attack (Reversi)

description:
Cassette 22: Chess II is an updated version of Cassette 13: Chess. The game does not feature a graphical depiction of the board nor the pieces. Instead, the player is expected to use their own physical board to supplement the gameplay and submit their moves (e.g. E2 - E4) into the game program.

Both one- and two-player modes are supported, along with nine available levels of intelligence for the AI opponent (up from six from the original) and the ability to ask the computer for advice on the next move. The game also features the ability to replay the log of a previously completed game in forward or reverse order. In an interesting twist, the option to disable the rules governing piece movement is available, allowing the player to move a piece anywhere on the board.
title: Cassette 22: Chess II

description: Super Knockout is a Breakout variant. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen and bounces a ball across the field to break bricks at the top.
title: Super Knockout

alternate_titles.title: Acetronic MPU 2000 Micro Processor TV Entertainment Centre (included game)

description: Invaders is a Space Invader variant. Players control a tank at the bottom of the screen and fire at incoming aliens that fly in diagonal patterns. There are various bunkers at the bottom of the screen to hide from incoming fire. A UFO can fly by at the top of the screen periodically which earns bonus points when shot down. The game plays significantly slower than the Arcade original, something that was rectified in the release for the Voltmace Database console variant. The game features a day and night mode for different difficulties as well as one and two-player variants with different weaponry and/or no bunkers.

sample_screenshots.caption: It looks and plays much like space invaders.
Some modes don't have barriers at all.
The game features several modes. In this instance, shots can be made to steer left or right.
A faster game mode, distinguished by the different background color.
One of the more challenging modes features twice the speed and no protective barriers.

title: Invaders

description: Shoot Out is a gun fighting game with a Western setting. The players control a cowboy on the screen and must try to hit each other with their pistol fire. The cowboys cannot shoot while moving, instead, they must enter a firing position after which the joystick is used to aim the gun rather than walk. After a shot, the player cannot exit the firing position until the bullet has hit something. A stagecoach and a cactus offer cover for the players. Different game variations offer different game rules such as the cover being breakable, being able to get up immediately after shooting or having a bullet limit. All game variants can also be played in a target practice mode where there is no second player present.
title: Shoot Out

description:
Cowboy is a gun fighting game with a Western setting bearing thematic similarities to Shoot Out for the 1292 Advanced Programmable Video Game System. The players control a cowboy on the screen and must try to hit each other with their pistol fire. The cowboys fire their bullets in horizontal lines and can hide behind objects for protection. The first player to have 30 hits on the opponent wins the game.

Game variations allow for different sizes for the cowboys, different backgrounds, invisible cowboys, and different firing distances and guided shots (during their path bullets can be moved up or down). A limited shot game limits the guns to 10 bullets, with guns being reloaded once both players shot all their bullets.
title: Cowboy

description: Monster Munchers is a Pac-Man variant for two players. One player must score as many points as possible as the muncher and must avoid the monster controlled by the other player. After charging at a charging station, the monster turns blue for a random duration of time and can be eaten by the muncher. Eating fruit will prolong the vulnerable period. When all four charging stations have been eaten, the muncher can return to the center of the area to respawn them. The maze has two exit tunnels (one at the top and one at the bottom), which lead back to the center, but when entering the tunnel, the player can also use it to quickly turn around and reenter the maze from where it was exited. The muncher has three lives after which the players can switch roles and see if the other muncher can earn more points.
title: Monster Munchers

description: Laser Attack is an action game in which the player flies a spacecraft and must avoid laser fire from the surface of a foreign planet. The player must destroy laser cannons to score points. For every 100 points, the player gains an extra life. The player starts with four lives. Different game variations allow the player to fire one or more times or play at a slower pace for younger or inexperienced players.
title: Laser Attack

description: Backgamon (sic) is a computer version of the board game backgammon. Players roll dice to move men over the game board with the aim of being the first to move all fifteen off of the board. The typical rules of Backgammon apply. Players roll two dice (if a pair is rolled it becomes four for that turn with the extra two being a copy of the original pair) to move their pieces to an empty slot, a slot occupied by their own pieces, or a slot that contains only one of their opponent's pieces. Doing that will send their opponent's piece back to their own home base. The game can be played against the computer or against another player.
title: Backgamon

description: Cassette 25: Bowling · Ninepins is a bowling game with sixteen different variations. Players take turns trying to knock over all the pins trying not to throw their ball in the gutter. The first player to hit 99 points wins the game. Different variations use different pin layouts, a different number of balls, or bonus points for leaving the lead pin standing, simultaneous play for two players, and single-player practice mode for all variations. In the fox hunting variation, one player starts with a lead and the other player must catch up before that player reaches 99 points.
title: Cassette 25: Bowling · Ninepins

description: Pacman Come-Come is a fairly obvious copy of Pac-Man. The player takes on the role of a yellow circle with a big mouth and eats dots in a maze. Four ghosts hunt the player but can be eaten after consuming a power pill. The goal is to score as many points as possible by eating dots, fruit, and ghosts.
title: Pacman Come-Come

description: Planet Defender is a Missile Command variant. The player is in control of planetary defense cannons and must intercept incoming missiles fired by the Zylons to the targets at the bottom of the screen.
title: Planet Defender

description: Cassette 28: Cockpit puts the player in the role of a pilot of a civil aircraft. The player must first successfully take off the plane and while in the air keep the horizon level and once the landing strip is shown land the plane again. If things go wrong the player can eject the pilot and must try to land him safely in between the cacti.
title: Cassette 28: Cockpit

description: Cassette 29: Metropolis/Hangman is a Hangman variant in which the player must guess cities by inputting letters. If the letter is in the city name that must be guessed the letter's location is shown (can be multiple locations). If the letter is not correct a man moves closer to the gallows. After six wrong guesses, the man is hanged and disappears through the floor. The score is kept for up to nine games so two players can compete for the best score.
title: Cassette 29: Metropolis/Hangman

description: Cassette 30: Solitaire is a peg jumping game for one person. A cross of 33 locations occupied by pegs is displayed on the screen. The player can jump pegs over others to remove the jumped peg. The goal is to clear the entire cross, leaving one final peg in the middle.
title: Cassette 30: Solitaire

description: Cassette 31: Casino allows one or two players to play either roulette or a slot machine. In both games, the players decide the stakes and must try to reach 1000 points in pretend money or have the other player go bust.
title: Cassette 31: Casino

description: Combate Naval is a naval combat game in the vein of Battleship. The game can be played with one or two players in 16 variants. Players must fire at hidden enemy ships by giving coordinates, which are then revealed to be a hit or a miss. The aim is to sink all enemy ships.
title: Combate Naval

description: Munch & Crunch is a Pac-Man variant for one or two players. One player is Crunch and the other can control two Munchies in the maze environment. Crunch must avoid the munchies and eat food placed in the maze, when enough food is eaten Crunch can exit the maze. When playing against the computer the computer is always the munchies.
title: Munch & Crunch

description: Leapfrog is a Frogger variant. The player controls a frog and must try to cross the screen, hopping between passing cars and over floating logs and waterlilies to the other side of a river. The game supports a two-player mode by alternating tries.
title: Leapfrog

description: Cassette 33: Super Invaders is an action game in which the players must prevent aliens from landing on the earth. Players fire guided missiles which must be led to the alien UFO. The UFO releases a landing craft that will try to construct a platform for the UFO to land on, which ends the game. The player must shoot down the landing crafts to prevent the platform from being constructed. The UFO also becomes vulnerable at times. Hitting it while it is vulnerable will cause part of the platform to be destroyed again. The UFO can also try to dodge the incoming missiles and go into hyperspace, where it is invisible. Hitting the invisible UFO actually damages it and can destroy it after which a new UFO will appear. There are multiple game variations and it can be played solo or with two players playing at the same time and competing for the highest score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Launching UFO ships
Completion of the construction of a UFO site
Ships are building a platform
Destruction of part of the site
The appearance of UFOs

title: Cassette 33: Super Invaders

description: Cassette 38: Hyperspace is an action game in which the players control spaceships. Moving the spaceship to hyperspace, firing missiles, and absorbing hits from enemies all cost energy. Players must find the mothership to refuel before energy runs out and eventually destroy all enemy ships. There are nine sectors in which the mothership can be located and players can use an overview map to find out where it currently is and where enemies can still be found. When playing with two players control is switched between players when using hyperspace. Only one player is active at a time, the other is always in hyperspace.
title: Cassette 38: Hyperspace

description: Cassette 40: Super-Space is a game similar to Defender. The player controls a spacecraft and can fly either left or right in a scrolling environment. Zylon spacecraft need to be shot down and energy stations defended. Indicators at the bottom of the screen show which energy station is currently under attack. When taking damage from enemy projectiles the ship's shields will deplete. Shields can be recharged in special stations. While recharging the player can fire homing missiles. When playing with two players one of the players controls the Zylons.
title: Cassette 40: Super-Space

description: Motocross is a motor stunt game. The player races a motorbike over a track and can perform risky jumps. There are different track types (wet and dry) and the game is over once the maximum number of crashes is reached.
title: Motocross

description: Super K.O. is a game played against another player or the computer. Players must destroy objects on the screen. There are 10 play variations.
title: Super K.O.

description: Concentración is a version of Monopoly. Players buy houses and land and collect rent when others enter their property. When funds are not sufficient mortgages can be taken until all but one players are bankrupt.
title: Concentración

description: Desafio al Computador is a puzzle game in which the computer poses logical problems for the player to solve. There are 12 different game variants. When the player answers incorrectly he or she is mocked.
title: Desafio al Computador

description: Telespiel: Überqueren der Fahrbahn is an educational game intended for German schools. In the game, the player controls a boy or a girl and is tasked with crossing a road in various different scenarios. Different types of traffic and crossings are presented. The goal is to safely cross the road.
title: Telespiel: Überqueren der Fahrbahn

description: ESS 003 is the third disc in the Elektor Software Service. It contains demonstration programs for the Elektor TV Games Computer and a game. The game included is Computer Challenge.
title: ESS 003

description: ESS-006 is a software compilation released on vinyl, included with Elektor magazine containing a color TV test pattern generator and a game. The game, going by the names Rocket Shooting and Space Shoot out is a simple shooting game. The player fires at a rocket and must try to destroy it before time runs out.
title: ESS-006
